Comment: ***From Business Insider's Bryan Metzger***:  Everywhere you look in Washington, [DOGE](https://www.businessinsider.com/doge-department-of-government-efficiency) is beginning to slow down.  It's not just that [Elon Musk](https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk) is preparing to [scale back his ](https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-stepping-back-doge-tesla-2025-4)[involvement](https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-stepping-back-doge-tesla-2025-4) in the project and devote more time to [Tesla](https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla). Nor is it merely that Musk's estimated $2 trillion in cuts to the federal budget have [shrunk to less than $200 billion](https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-lowers-doges-estimated-savings-again-2025-4). DOGE-related initiatives on Capitol Hill — where decisions about government spending are ultimately made — are also losing steam.  "That's one of my big frustrations right now," Republican Rep. Tim Burchett of Tennessee told BI. "The president's DOGE agenda is all through executive orders, and not through anything else."  A [House caucus](https://www.businessinsider.com/doge-caucus) established to provide cost-cutting ideas to DOGE has had little interaction with the Trump administration. On Wednesday, a House panel created to support government efficiency efforts held a hearing on transgender athletes in fencing. And plans to vote on [making DOGE cuts permanent](https://www.businessinsider.com/doge-rescissions-congress-republicans-complicated-2025-3) have stalled as well.  Despite the shock and awe of Musk's first several weeks in government, time has shown that DOGE is still subject to the laws of political gravity. Musk has [become unpopular](https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-future-wisconsin-supreme-court-tesla-deliveries-numbers-2025-4), DOGE has faced [massive blowback](https://www.businessinsider.com/chuck-edwards-town-hall-asheville-north-carolina-doge-2025-3) from the public, and Tesla — the source of most of Musk's wealth — has become the [target of protests](https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-showroom-design-architecture-marketing-perfect-targets-elon-musk-protests-2025-4).  The substance of Musk's project is also at risk. Though Congress has largely [taken a backseat](https://www.businessinsider.com/doge-caucus-subcommittee-congress-too-fast-ideas-2025-2) to the executive branch in the initial months of [President Donald Trump's](https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump) term, the legislative branch will have to act to ensure that any changes made by DOGE aren't reversible by the next administration.  [Read more](https://www.businessinsider.com/doge-congress-subcommittee-caucus-rescissions-2025-5?utm_source=reddit&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=insider-politics-sub-post).
Author: thisisinsider
